question_text: Why can thin clients used in a VDI environment be built with minimal local CPU, memory, and storage?
answer_options: Because thin clients use AI to simulate hardware resources
Because all application processing occurs in the cloud-hosted virtual machine
Because thin clients are preloaded with virtualized apps
Because thin clients use containers instead of full OS environments
correct_answer: Because all application processing occurs in the cloud-hosted virtual machine
explanation: In VDI, the desktop OS runs remotely. The thin client handles only input, output, and network traffic.
